00021 #ifndef GAUSSIAN_KERNEL_H
00022 #define GAUSSIAN_KERNEL_H
00023 
00024 // After this many standard deviations set kernel weight to 0
00025 // This will affect the number of observations the kernel spans
00026 #define G_KERNEL_SPAN 2.0
00027 
00028 #include <valarray>
00029 
00030 using namespace std;
00031 
00032 class GaussianKernel
00033 {
00034 public:
00035   // Ready to configure after declaration. But no way to do it yet.
00036   GaussianKernel();
00037 
00038   // Construct the weights inside the constructor.  This could be moved
00039   // outside of the constructor.
00040   // Preconfigured instance
00041   GaussianKernel(const double sigma_in);
00042 
00043   // How many observations lead in front of the kernel center
00044   unsigned int lead();
00045 
00046   // How may observations lag behind the kernel center
00047   unsigned int lag();
00048 
00049   // The weights the kernel uses
00050   valarray<double>weights();
00051 
00052   // The standard deviation the kernel uses for weights
00053   double sigma();
00054 
00055   // The number of probes that the kernel spans
00056   unsigned int size();
00057   // What happens when a datum is fed into the leading edge of the kernel
00058   double step(const double val);
00059 
00060 private:
00061   unsigned int m_lead;
00062   unsigned int m_lag;
00063   unsigned int m_size;
00064   double m_sigma;
00065   valarray<double>m_weights;
00066   valarray<double>m_data;
00067 };
00068 
00069 
00070 #endif
